frameDefinitions: Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Duty needs to be fulfilled by a  Responsible_party.
Unless a particular Required_situation obtains, Negative_consequences will follow.
An single Subpart breaks off from a Whole.
The words in this frame describe a period of time, as opposed to a point in time.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Responsible_party is required to perform some Duty.
frameExamples: It would <t>behoove</t> us to comprehend and personalize what Jesus had to tell his disciples
You <t>must</t> turn in your test by 5 p.m.
The original sword may have <t>chipped</t> off of the statue long ago.
The best <t>time</t> of year for planting tends to be fairly regular.
It is my <t>duty</t> to fight any attack on the Brotherhood .
listRoleDefinitions: The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The time interval during which the <fen>Duty</fen> is mandatory.
A location in which the <fen>Duty</fen>  obtains.
The period during which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary to prevent negative consequences.
The location within which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is required.
The part of the <fen>Whole</fen> that is conceived as being broken or taken off from the remaining part of the whole.
The piece that is presented in a less prominent position, and which is the landmark or remaining whole from which <fen>Sub_part</fen> breaks off.
The time at which the breaking off of the <fen>Sub_part</fen> happens.
The location at which the breaking off occurs.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>State</fen>'s duration.  In this frame, the duration can be inexact.
An ongoing state whose duration can be measured.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The time interval during which the Responsibly_party is obligated to fulfill the Duty.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
listRoleExamples: <fex>Getting a shot against yellow fever</fex> is obligatory for travellers to Benin.
The use of TM software is obligatory <fex>for every freelance translator working on projects for our company</fex>.
<fex>These days</fex>, wearing a seat-belt is mandatory.
Gymnasium is not obligatory <fex>in Sweden</fex>, but nearly everyone attends gymnasium
He was told that <fex>when he got back</fex> , his column needed a serious rethink .
<fex>In California</fex> , seatbelts must be fastened at all times .
The handle broke off of the pot.
The handle broke <fex>off of the pot</fex>.
<fex>He was a great actor</fex> in his time.
My job is <fex>to get to the other side of the bridge</fex>.
<fex>At that time</fex> men were obligated to marry women from their own community.
I almost forgot to tell you that <fex>in Sweden</fex> we are obligated to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.
